metadata.titel_preek: Why Modern Man Needs The Gospel

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of a decaying society and the individual soul through the power of the Gospel to counteract the 'fall' into idolatry and facelessness.

subject.identificatie: The Gospel / Jesus Christ (as the Power of God)
tekstueel_bewijs: it is the power of God unto salvation
Jesus Christ calls us out of the crowd
the presence and the power of Christ that enables us to sing

object.identificatie: Salvation (defined as identity, social cohesion, and hope)
tekstueel_bewijs: save us at the crucial points of our failure
stand a soul on its feet
true visions and real dreams come from God
there is a final 'yes' in God
save us from our lost hope
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in need of help).

helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject (the actor) rather than just a helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the 'power' that enables singing and marching.

tekstueel_bewijs: passions rush forth like mad demons
the loud 'no' of evil and sin and death
soul-defeating mass that we call 'the public'
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a force that 'disfigures and scars all of life' and leads to the fall of empires.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of seeing others as children of God to save the nation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / American Citizen
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ability to see others as children of God (Secondary) is predicated on the Gospel calling the individual out of the crowd (Primary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Gospel → Restoration of Human Worth

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can live together only as we see...

voorbeelden: I know that I am not a faceless man
it is the power of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of power (impotence) in modern man and the endowment of power (competence) through the Gospel.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Gospel) to S2 (Rome's fall), then to ~S1 (Modern Pride), and finally back to S1 (The final 'Yes' of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'triumph of Christ' which overrules the 'no' of sin.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the fall of Rome and the list of sins in Romans 1 are used to show the terminal nature of life without God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon addresses social issues, the 'engine' is the power of God. Man is depicted as fundamentally unable to save himself or the nation through 'political shrewdness.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our American society will endure only as we see each other as children of God.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of identity
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ calls us out of the crowd one by one.
We need help from the outside.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples to follow, but as witnesses (Paul) or warnings (Rome).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon is already theocentric; Paul is a herald, not a hero.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from a sense of mass-anonymity to individual dignity and hope.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is an ontological change in how one is 'seen' and 'called' by God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the individual 'soul on its feet' to the social 'blessed community' is logically linked through the concept of the 'image of God.'
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of the Gospel power and the 'not yet' of America's current decay.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: mightier than the loud 'no' of evil and sin and death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Gospel provides the 'power' (Pouvoir) that man lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'contagion' and 'mad demons' that lead to total societal collapse.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/The Gospel as the Subject of the primary narrative, avoiding the trap of making 'mutual respect' the cause of salvation rather than its fruit.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the 'modern man's' false sense of Pouvoir.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God calls us) → Ethics (We see others as children of God).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a theocentric sermon that addresses social crisis without lapsing into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the evocative imagery of Rome; Greimas shows that Rome is an actantial 'Opponent' representing the failure of the human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Romans 1; semiotics shows how the 'Power of God' functions as the narrative engine for both the 1st and 20th centuries.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's strength lies in its 'Subject-switch'—moving the agency of social survival from 'political shrewdness' to 'the power of God.'

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Sparrow' hymn to shift the modal competence from Devoir (I must feel okay) to Pouvoir (I can sing because He watches me).
